solution_line_template: The team did {additional_rounds_saturday} more rounds on day one which took {additional_rounds_saturday}*{time_per_round} = <<{additional_rounds_saturday}*{time_per_round}={time_additional_rounds_saturday}>>{time_additional_rounds_saturday} minutes.

The total time they took circumnavigating the land on the first day is {time_additional_rounds_saturday}+{time_initial_round_saturday} = <<{time_additional_rounds_saturday}+{time_initial_round_saturday}={total_time_saturday}>>{total_time_saturday} minutes.

On the second day, they did {rounds_sunday} rounds, which took {time_per_round} minutes each, giving {rounds_sunday}*{time_per_round} = <<{rounds_sunday}*{time_per_round}={total_time_sunday}>>{total_time_sunday} minutes.
The total number of rounds took {total_time_saturday}+{total_time_sunday} = <<{total_time_saturday}+{total_time_sunday}={total_time_weekend}>>{total_time_weekend} minutes.
